pullrequest.title: cpu cases now included when configured by yaml

content.raw:
Both of these issues are more in the scope of PR #139

1. \(Without seeing the numbers\) The GPS unit looks like it is in compliance because the origin of the GPS unit is within the bounding boxes for the sensors \(definately want to look at the numbers and hand check to see if we just found a bug with compliance check\). If we feel this is and issue the best solution that we can do right now is just to make the bounding boxes smaller, which is an easy fix. More in depth solutions may evaluate a sensors collision geometry and determine if it is in the box that way, but would require some work, not sure if it is that big of an issue.
2. I think that it is important to keep this because the program still generates a wamv. Maybe we should change/ add more messages to convey that the wamv which was generated is not in compliance.
content.html:
Both of these issues are more in the scope of PR #139

  1. (Without seeing the numbers) The GPS unit looks like it is in compliance because the origin of the GPS unit is within the bounding boxes for the sensors (definately want to look at the numbers and hand check to see if we just found a bug with compliance check). If we feel this is and issue the best solution that we can do right now is just to make the bounding boxes smaller, which is an easy fix. More in depth solutions may evaluate a sensors collision geometry and determine if it is in the box that way, but would require some work, not sure if it is that big of an issue.
  2. I think that it is important to keep this because the program still generates a wamv. Maybe we should change/ add more messages to convey that the wamv which was generated is not in compliance.
